intro: Cullen discolor, commonly known as the white cullen, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine, soft hairs. Cullen discolor thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
